title: He Really Said That
description: Audio library of Donald J. Trump quotes. Built with JavaScript, jQuery, HandlebarsJS, HTML5, and CSS3. Skeleton was used for the basic page layout.

title: No Spoilers
description: This application was created as the Code Fellows 401: Advanced Full-Stack JavaScript mid-point project that I was a part of. The application allows users to selectively filter TV series episode summaries based on what they have and have not seen in order to avoid "spoilers". We were a team of three that put this app together over five days. The app was built with NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB on the back-end for data persistence. The front-end utilizes jQuery, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3, as well as SuperAgent to implement AJAX requests. I put together methods on our Mongoose models that controlled user interactions with the back-end data, including the important piece of controlling what the user can access based on their approved episode lists.
category: NodeJSExpress, MongoDB, Mongoose, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3

title: U.S. Housing Affordability Tool
description: This was the Code Fellows 301: Intermediate Software Development final project that I was a part of. We were a team of five and built this application over the course of five days. I contributed significantly on the JavaScript logic driving the user interaction with the map that is the central focus of the application. I also set-up all interactions with third-party API's, including the U.S. Census API for demographic data.

title: Projects Manager
description: Project built with Vanilla JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 for managing projects and employees. This project utilizes the Window's localStorage property to act as a simple database. The end user would be an administrator at a company who needs to keep track of large numbers of projects and the employees working on those projects. Projects and employees can be added and edited, and employees can be moved from project to project.

title: Blood Pressure Tracker
description: This incomplete project will be a simple application that uses the MEAN stack in order to allow users to keep track of their daily Blood Pressure reading. This page is built with Javascript, Angular, HTML5, CSS3 and SCSS on the front-end, and uses Chart.js to allow user to view the history of their readings in chart form. The back-end utilizes NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB for persistent data. User authorization is controlled in Angular on the front-end, and by using Express middleware on the back-end.
category: The MEAN Stack: MongoDB, Express, Angular, NodeJS

title: PDX Farm Finder
description: This incomplete project will allow users to search for farms in the Portland area by proximity as well as by what the farm grows and sells. This project is built with PHP, a MySQL database, Javascript, HTML, and CSS. The project utilizes the Google Maps API in order to add map search functionality to the page.
